Class Username

java.lang.Object
com.example.game.scene.account.Username
public class Username extends Object
Username class. Check player's username before start game.

      public Username()

  • Method Details

    • usernameIsValid

      public static boolean usernameIsValid(String username)
      Check if player's username is valid. Check username from player's input text field (usernameField). If username is valid, return true. If username is not valid, return false.
      Parameters:
      username - player's username
      Returns:
      boolean

    • checkUsernameLength

      public static boolean checkUsernameLength(String username)
      Check if username's length is valid. Return true if length < 15 and > 2. Return false if length > 16 and < 3.
      Parameters:
      username - player's username
      Returns:
      boolean

    • checkUsernameBlankSpace

      public static boolean checkUsernameBlankSpace(String username)
      Check if username's contain blank space. Return true if username don't have blank space. Return false if username have blank space.
      Parameters:
      username - player's username
      Returns:
      boolean

    • checkUsernameCharacter

      public static boolean checkUsernameCharacter(String username)
      Check if username's contain only letter or digit. Return true if username contain only letter or digit. Return false if username contain special character.
      Parameters:
      username - player's username
      Returns:
      boolean

    • usernameInvalidDialog

      public static void usernameInvalidDialog(String context)
      If username is not valid, warning dialog will pop out. Warning dialog informs the player on their relative mistake.
      Parameters:
      context - context of warning dialog
